page.title: 05CLUBS
page.content: In 1985, there are quite a number of clubs and social activities in the district of Shirwell. There is a Women's Institute which meets at the village hall monthly on a Tuesday evening. An annual subscription is paid, half of which goes towards the cost of running county and national headquarters. In Shirwell, country crafts are particularly encouraged. A member is sent each year to the Annual General Meeting in London to vote on motions according to the wishes of Shirwell's Institute. The Shell Group is a club for children which meets at the Methodist Chapel in an evening. Games are played and handicraft work is taught. Sometimes there are displays. During the Summer months, a playscheme is often operated for the younger members of the community.
